properties.areaDesc: Wayne; Perry; Bollinger; Ripley; Carter; Butler
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 3:58PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
A clipper-type system will move through the area late this
afternoon and early evening. This system is expected to produce
minor accumulations of light snowfall over westernmost parts of
southeastern Missouri, especially in the higher elevations of the
Ozark Foothills. Up to a half inch of snowfall is possible in the
higher elevations. Some impacts to travel may occur there, as
snow will be more likely to stick to roads and elevated surfaces
such as bridges and overpasses after nightfall. This may result in
slick spots, especially on untreated, lesser traveled roadways.

Plan on the possibility of slick spots on the evening commute.
Please slow down and use caution while driving.
